text.p: These are the leading stories in Botswana's independent weekly newspaper published on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- No successor has yet been found for Professor Thomas Tlou, vice-chancellor of the University of Botswana, who retires on June 15. However, a spokeman for the university council said hundreds of applications had been received from all over the world.

- A Motswana woman, exposed in a document given to South Africa's Truth and Reconciliation Commission by the ruling African National Congress as a spy for the former apartheid government, has been asked to resign as Councillor for the Lobase Farms area.
